word:
Here is the strength of Christ's prayer for unity: "That the world may believe that Thou hast sent Me. And the glory [character] which Thou gavest Me I have given them; that they may be one, even as we are one. [Wonderful request; it seems almost too great for expectation!] I in them, and Thou in Me, that they may be made perfect in one; and that the world may know that 


                                      -192- 

Thou hast sent Me, and hast loved them, as Thou hast loved Me" [verses 21-23].
